chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Desmann J. Escalante was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).
  • Desmann J. Escalante was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Desmann J. Escalante was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Desmann J. Escalante was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
10:54 AM Defendant Desmann J. Escalante in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Defendant Desmann J. Escalante in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14cf249 and 16CF245 called. Agreement stated 16CF245 ct 1 - 2 yrs probation consecutive to Shawano Co case 18CF311. 
14CF249 ct 1 - 2 yrs probation cc to 16CF245 and cs to Shawano 18CF311, costs, DNA, AODA and follow through, absolute sobriety, no presence in places with Class B liquor license, obtain/maintain full time work/school or combination, counseling deemed necessary by agent.
ct 2 - 1 yr probation, cc to ct 1, comply with conditions in ct 1.
ct 3 - w/h sentence, 2 yrs pr, cc to 16CF245, cs to Shawano 18CF311, $3000 fine, 9 mo jail, 36 mo revoke, IID 36 mo, AODA and driver safety plan, conditions in ct 1.
ct 5 - costs. State advises honoring agreement that was previously accepted. Court verifies all are withheld sentences. Court asks for clarification regarding conditional jail on ct 3. Response by Counsel. Discussion regarding credit. Def understands agreement and agrees. Sentencing remarks by counsel. State has complied with VWNR. Brief statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. Orders on 16CF245 ct 1 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, consecutive to Shawano co case 18CF311. Court costs, $250 DNA surcharge, DNA sample if not already on file. No credit for time served.
14CF249 ct 1 - withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, all today consecutive to Shawano Co case, cc to each other, costs, DNA surcharge, AODA and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, no presence in places with Class B liquor license, maintain full time work/school or combination 30 hrs/wk or applying for at least 5 jobs/wk that qualified for, counseling deemed beneficial. ct 2 - w/held sentence, 1 yr probation, costs, DNA surcharge, ct 3 w/held sentence, 2 yrs probation, $3000 fine plus costs, $250 DNA surcharge, 9 months jail, Court does not object to being in county jail with huber or can be in prison. 36 month revocation w/credit for any admin susp. 36 mo IID effective when valid license, alcohol assessment and driver safety plan. Credit for 14 days served on 9 months.  ct 5 - costs- DNA surcharge waived.  Court waives DNA surcharge on cts 2 and 5. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. BAC .14 Pmt plan or civil judgment for ct 5.
Sentencing hearing on June 27, 2019 at 10:30 am.

Court calls 16CF245, 16TR1460, 14CF249, & 16TR1459 @ 2:43 pm.  Defendant Desmann J. Escalante in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives plea agreement 16CF245 Ct 1 plea, DRI Ct 2, waiver or p.h., 14CF249 Ct 1 plea, withheld sentence 2 years probation, costs, DNA surcharge, DNA sample, AODA and follow through, Maintain absolute sobriety, Full time employement or schooling, counseling deemed necessary, ct 2 withheld sentence 1 year probation, concurrent, ct 3 Amended Information OWI 4th w/in 5 years 2 years probation, 3000 fine plus costs, 9 months jail, 36 months revocation & IID, AODA and complete driver safety plan, ct 4 dismissed and consolidated and ct 5 plea costs. TR citations dismissed.  Atty Goetz agrees to plea agreement and defense free to argue.  State does not agree about free to argue.  Atty Goetz is still ready to proceed.  16CF245 Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charges and penalties.  16CF245 Ct 1 Bailjumping, Guilty plea.  14CF249 Ct 1 Misappropriate ID inf, Guilty plea, Ct 2 Obstructing, Guilty plea. Ct 3 OWI 4 within 5 years, Guilty plea  Ct 5 OAR, Guilty plea.  Court grants States motion in 16CF245 ct 2 DRI, in 14CF249 Ct 4 dismissed and consolidated.  16TR1460 & 16TR1459 Dismissed. Def. advised of constitutional right & JT. rights. Def. admits 3 prior convictions.  Def. understands elements.  Def. makes statement on guidelines.  State replys.  Court explains to def. Def. understand stood  plea was 120 days jail.  Court will hear def. argument at sentencing.  Atty Goetz is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to 14CF249 Ct 1 Misappropriate ID inf, Ct 2 Obstructing, Ct 3 OWI 4 within 5 years,  Ct 5 OAR and 16CF245 Ct 1 Bailjumping.  Court will grant adjournment on sentencing. Bonds continue.  14CF249 Victim rights complied with. Def. gives current address on record.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Amended
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of hearing returned
Status conference on May 1, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Desmann J. Escalante in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CF249, 16CF245, 16TR1459& 16TR1460 @ 9:06 am.  State gives plea agreement, 16TR1459, 16TR1460 Dismissed, 16CF245 DRI, 14CF249, plea to ct 1, ct 2, ct 3, ct 4 Dismissed and consolidated, ct 5. ct 1 & 2 withheld sentence, 2 years probation, costs & AODA Absolute Sobriety counseling, ct 3 5 days jail,  1379 fine, 12 months revocation, 12 months IID, AODA, ct 5 costs.  Atty Goetz and defendant agrees to plea agreement.  Court question fine feels old guidelines.  No DNA surcharge on misdemeanor, only the felony.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights.  Def. understands charges and penalties.  Atty Goetz has on form OWI 3rd.  Court has charged as 2nd offense.   State finds OWI 2nd in Shawano and OWI 3rd in Winnebago.  This would make this a OWI 4th offense.  Atty Goetz feels a plea has been accepted.  Atty Goetz has an amended complaint.  State looks at information that was filed.  State has an amended complaint in file however never filed.  Court can't allow sentence on a OWI 4th.  Court would like authority and case law.  Atty Goetz heard on guidelines.  Court heard on statute.  Court will not continue with sentencing. 16CF245 Atty Goetz is representing def.  Atty Goetz mis-spoke is not representing def.  Atty Goetz appears special and waives reading of complaint, and waives time limits of p.h. Def. advised to contact Public Defender. Atty Goetz is representing def. Pro bo no. Bond continues.  Def. waives time limits for p.h. State is revoking offer. Atty Goetz heard on offer. 16CF245 Time limits waived on p.h. Court accepts waiver time limits. Atty Goetz makes statement on Pro Bo no.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 14, 2017 at 09:00 am.
